meanings.definition: Proud or haughty in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: The peacock strutted around the farm, looking orgulous with its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent2: She always walked with an orgulous air, as if she owned the entire town.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the windowsill, orgulous as if it were the king of the house.
meanings.sent4: The towering skyscraper stood orgulous among the surrounding buildings.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood orgulous in the middle of the forest, its branches reaching proudly towards the sky.

meanings.sent1: His orgulous attitude made it difficult for others to approach him.
meanings.sent2: The rich man's orgulous behavior towards the staff was unacceptable.
meanings.sent3: The orgulous cat turned its nose up at the simple food in its bowl.
meanings.sent4: The orgulous eagle soared high above, looking down on everything below.
meanings.sent5: The orgulous queen refused to speak to anyone she deemed unworthy of her attention.

meanings.sent1: Her orgulous display of wealth made her unpopular among her peers.
meanings.sent2: The politician's orgulous speeches alienated many voters.
meanings.sent3: The orgulous peacock preened its feathers, thinking itself the most beautiful creature.
meanings.sent4: The orgulous athlete boasted about their achievements to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent5: The orgulous king paraded through the streets, expecting adoration from his subjects.
